author: The Telegraph
title: 30 Days of SPECTRE Terms and Conditions
text: 1. The “30 Days pf SPECTRE” prize draws are open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and Sony Pictures (“Sony”)], their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via telegraph.co.uk/spectre and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. 5. The winner(s) for each draw will be the first entry or entries drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date for that draw. An up to date list of the winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a stamped addressed envelope to 30 Days of SPECTRE Prize Draws Winners, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the final prize draw. 6. Each prize draw opens at 09:00 on the day on which it is published and closes at 23:59 on the same. 7. The winner(s) of each prize draw will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone or email within 14 days of the closing date of the draw in which they are a winner. Should the Promoter be unable to contact a winner or should a winner be unable to accept their prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award that prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 8. The prize(s) as described in promotional copy is/are available on the date of publication. Should a prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 9. The prize in the first prize draw is subject to further terms and condition. Full details can be found in the Appendix to these terms and conditions, below. 10. Where a prize is a package, the prize must be taken as one package. 11. The prize(s) is/are subject to availability and to any published restrictions. The prize(s) is/are non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 12. Winners may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of Sony and the Promoter. 13. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 14. Events may occur that render a prize draw itself or the awarding of a prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 15. The Telegraph is responsible for the publication, administration and adjudication of the prize draws. Provision of the prizes is the responsibility of Sony. 16. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. Appendix Prize Details Day 1: A five-night holiday for two to Morocco. The prize package comprises: • Return economy class flights from London to Casablanca; • Return flights from Casablanca to Erfoud; • Two nights hotel accommodation in Caasablanca; • Three nights hotel accommodation in Erfoud; and • Four wheel drive Sahara adventure. Terms and Conditions 1. Accommodation is based on two people sharing a twin or double room on a bed and breakfast basis. 2. The winner’s guest must meet the age criteria according to the film’s certification. 3. Where the winner’s guest is under 18 years of age, they must have prior parental or guardian permission. 4. On arrival at the hotel, the winner will be required to present a valid credit card as a security deposit. 5. The prize is valid for travel on Thursday to Tuesday during March 3 and June 28 and September 15 and December 13, 2016, excluding Moroccan national holidays. 6. The prize does not include travel between the winner’s home and the airport, travel insurance, transfers, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs, other than where mentioned. It is the responsibility of the prize winner to ensure both they and their guest each has a valid passport and travel insurance and obtain any necessary vaccinations and visas for their trip. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
